column1: Troitsk (Russian: Тро́ицк) is a town in Troitsky Administrative Okrug of the federal city of Moscow
column3: located on the Desna River 37 kilometers (23 mi) southwest from the center of Moscow on the Kaluzhskoye Highway. Population: 39

column1: Troitsk was first mentioned in 1646 as a settlement of Troitskoye. It was renamed Troitsk and granted town status in 1977. Until July 1
column3: it was a part of Moscow Oblast but was transferred to Moscow's jurisdiction along with other territories in the southwest.

column2: 2012 Troitsk was transferred to the city of Moscow and became a part of the newly established Troitsky Administrative Okrug.Prior to the transfer
column3: within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: it was incorporated as Troitsk Town Under Oblast Jurisdiction—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: Troitsk Town Under Oblast Jurisdiction was incorporated as Troitsk Urban Okrug.

column1: It is home of a number of research institutes of the Russian Academy of Sciences

column2: Ionosphere and Radio Wave Propagation of the Russian Academy of Sciences

column1: Institute for High Pressure Physics Russian Academy of Sciences
Institute for Spectroscopy of the Russian Academy of Sciences
Technological Institute for Superhard and Novel Carbon Materials
Troitsk Institute of Innovative and Thermonuclear Research
Branch of the Prokhorov General Physics Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences
